item.title: Litehaus raises €1.46M pre-seed to build home-building platform
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: All Thibault Launay and his wife Simi wanted nearly five years ago was to build a dream home in Portugal, where they both now live.  But what they encountered instead was a broken system. “Fourteen months of delays, 20% budget overruns, and endless stress managing over 10 subcontractors,” Thibault recalled. They bought the land in […]

item.title: Opera’s new browser can code websites and games for you
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: Opera's new browser, called Opera Neon, will focus on AI workflows and performing tasks for you, like shopping, coding and generating reports.

item.title: Humain planning $10B VC fund to invest in US, European and Asian startups
item.dc:creator: Ram Iyer
item.description: Humain, the state-owned AI company from Saudi Arabia, is reportedly on track to launch a $10 billion venture fund, Humain Ventures.

item.title: SpaceX’s ninth test flight of Starship launches into space, ends in a spin
item.dc:creator: Kirsten Korosec
item.description: SpaceX’s Starship successfully separated from its Super Heavy rocket booster and reached orbit Tuesday evening, but later began spinning and made an uncontrolled re-entry into the Indian Ocean. SpaceX had cleared the surrounding airspace where Starship was coming down, according to the company. The ninth test flight provided a mix of successes and failures for […]

item.title: Anthropic launches a voice mode for Claude
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description: Anthropic has begun to roll out a “voice mode” for its Claude chatbot apps. The voice mode (in beta for now) allows Claude mobile app users to have “complete spoken conversations with Claude,” and will arrive in English over the next few weeks, according to Anthropic’s official account on X and updated documentation on the […]

item.title: OpenAI may soon let you ‘sign in with ChatGPT’ for other apps
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description: OpenAI is exploring ways for users to sign in to third-party apps using their ChatGPT account, the company noted on a web page published Tuesday. OpenAI is currently gauging interest from developers who might want to integrate this service into their apps. ChatGPT is quickly becoming one of the largest consumer applications in the world, […]

item.title: Read-it-later app Pocket is shutting down — here are the best alternatives
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta, Sarah Perez
item.description: Pocket users have until October 8, 2025, to export their saved articles and other items, including lists, archives, favorites, notes, and highlights.

item.title: Texas signs into law online safety bill reportedly opposed by Apple’s Tim Cook
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: Gov. Abbott of Texas officially signed into law the online child safety bill that will require Apple and Google’s app stores to verify the age of their users and obtain approval from parents before minors download or make in-app purchases. The law will go into effect on January 1. The bill made headlines last week […]

item.title: Rivr’s dog-like robots join Veho vans to solve ‘last-100-yards’ parcel delivery in Austin
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: Zurich-based robotics startup Rivr is partnering with Veho to deliver parcels in Austin.

item.title: Meta reportedly splits its AI team to build products faster
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: Now, the company's AI personnel will be assigned to an AI products team, or an AGI Foundations unit. No jobs appear to have been cut.

item.title: AI may already be shrinking entry-level jobs in tech, new research suggests
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description: If and when AI will start replacing human labor has been the subject of numerous debates.   While it’s still hard to say with certainty if AI is beginning to take over roles previously done by humans, a recent survey from the World Economic Forum found that 40% of employers intend to cut staff where AI […]

item.title: WordPress has formed an AI team
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: WordPress announced on Tuesday that it has formed an AI team to steward the development of AI products among its developer community. The team includes James LePage (leader of AI at Automattic, WordPress’ parent company), Felix Arntz and Pascal Birchler from Google, and Jeff Paul (Director of Open Source at web design firm 10up). As […]

item.title: Report: TuSimple sent sensitive self-driving data to China after US national security agreement
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: Self-driving truck startup TuSimple sent a trove of sensitive data to a Beijing-owned firm after committing to the U.S. government that it would cease such transfers under a national security agreement

item.title: Salesforce acquires Informatica for $8 billion
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description: Salesforce has acquired cloud data management firm Informatica in an $8 billion equity deal, marking a major move in its push to strengthen its AI and data infrastructure capabilities. The announcement, made Tuesday, comes about a year after early rumors of the acquisition sent both companies’ stock prices sliding. At the time, Informatica denied it […]

item.title: Tesla loses more ground in Europe, while BYD makes gains
item.dc:creator: Kirsten Korosec
item.description: In April, Tesla sold 7,261 vehicles in the European Union, European Free Trade Association, and U.K., a 49% year-over-year decline.

item.title: YouTube tops Disney and Netflix in TV viewing, Nielsen finds
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description: Nielsen’s latest report serves as another wake-up call that YouTube is rapidly gaining ground in the TV landscape. On Tuesday, Nielsen released its April 2025 “Media Distributor Gauge” report, which showed that YouTube has achieved a significant milestone: It has maintained the largest share of TV viewing for three consecutive months, now accounting for 12.4% […]

item.title: WhatsApp launches long-awaited iPad app
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: WhatsApp is officially available on iPad, Meta announced on Tuesday. The new iPad app allows you to make video and audio calls with up to 32 people, share your screen, and use both front and back cameras. Up until now, if you wanted to use WhatsApp on your iPad, you had to use the web […]

item.title: Ahead of WWDC, Apple says App Store blocked $2B in fraud transactions last year, $9B in past 5 years
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: Apple said it has prevented more than $9 billion in fraudulent transactions over the past five years, $2 billion of which it blocked in 2024.

item.title: Two more heavy hitters join StrictlyVC’s star-studded lineup in Menlo Park
item.dc:creator: TechCrunch Events
item.description: Mark your calendars: June 18 just became a can’t-miss event. We’re thrilled that Ali Partovi and Russell Kaplan will be joining us for what’s shaping up to be a fantastic night of ideas and conversation in the heart of Silicon Valley at our next StrictlyVC evening, taking place in Menlo Park. Partovi, the longtime investor […]

item.title: Netflix CPO Eunice Kim is coming to TechCrunch Disrupt 2025 to talk tech, tools, and yes, its password-sharing strategy
item.dc:creator: TechCrunch Events
item.description: We’re absolutely thrilled to announce that Eunice Kim, chief product officer of Netflix, will be joining us on the main stage at TechCrunch Disrupt’s 20th anniversary celebration this October 27-29 at Moscone West in San Francisco! As we mark two decades of TechCrunch Disrupt, there’s perhaps no better embodiment of transformative growth than Netflix’s journey […]
